ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.2_0: the monks from the group of six tickled one of the monks from the group of seventeen to make him laugh.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.3_0: He fainted, and not being able to catch his breath, he died.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.4_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.5_0: “How can the monks from the group of six tickle a monk to make him laugh?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.6_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.9_0: “... Foolish men, how can you tickle a monk to make him laugh?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.10_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.11_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:1.12.1_0: ‘If a monk tickles another, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.1.2_0: if one who is fully ordained touches another who is fully ordained body to body, with the aim of making him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.1_0: If the other person is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he tickles him to make him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.2_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he tickles him to make him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.3_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he tickles him to make him laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.4_0: If, with his own body, he touches what is connected to the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.5_0: If, with what is connected to his own body, he touches the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.6_0: If, with what is connected to his own body, he touches what is connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.7_0: If, by releasing something, he touches the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.8_0: If, by releasing something, he touches what is connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.9_0: If, by releasing something, he touches what is released by the other monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.10_0: If, with his own body, he touches the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.11_0: If, with his own body, he touches what is connected to the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.12_0: If, with what is connected to his own body, he touches the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.13_0: If, with what is connected to his own body, he touches what is connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.14_0: If, by releasing something, he touches the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.15_0: If, by releasing something, he touches what is connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.16_0: If, by releasing something, he touches what is released by the other monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.17_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.18_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.2.19_0: If it is to one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.2_0: if he is not aiming to have fun;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.3_0: if he touches him when there is a need;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc52:2.3.6_0: The second rule, the training rule on tickling, is finished.
